department.en: Department of Space Science and Engineering

goal.ch: This course will give students an introduction to Solar-Terrestrial Physics, a field that mainly studies the Sun-Earth connection. The Sun constantly releases charged particles into the interplanetary space and becomes the solar wind. The solar wind interacts with the Earth’s dipolar magnetosphere. The resulted magnetosphere has a configuration of being compressed on the dayside and stretched on the nightside. The bow shock is formed in front of the magnetosphere. The course will start with an introduction to Space Plasma, which is necessary for understandings of physical mechanism underlying space phenomena. The course covers different areas of Solar-Terrestrial Physics. The knowledge of these areas is necessary for academic research and practical applications.
